intro: Psychotria conferta, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria conferta is also known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
